verses.roman:
anuvāda āge, pāche vidheya sthāpana
sei artha kahi, śuna śāstra-vivaraṇa

synonyms: anuvāda—the subject; āge—first; pāche—afterwards; vidheya—the predicate; sthāpana—placing; sei—this; artha—the meaning; kahi—I speak; śuna—please listen; śāstra-vivaraṇa—to the description of the scriptures.
translation: A predicate always follows its subject. Now I shall explain the meaning of this verse according to the revealed scriptures.
